<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 645, 89]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the stretching of a spring.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 103, 260, 120]]<|/det|>
Refer to Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[232, 128, 761, 388]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 401, 532, 420]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 434, 146, 452]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 434, 920, 467]]<|/det|>
The metre ruler is clamped in position near to the spring. Do **not** change the position of the metre ruler.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 481, 183, 500]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 481, 920, 529]]<|/det|>
Measure the unstretched length \(l_0\) of the spring. Record \(l_0\) in cm in Table 1.1. Do **not** include the loops at the ends of the spring in your measurement. The value \(l_0\) is the length of the spring when the load \(L\) is 0.00N.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 510, 920, 528]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 542, 181, 560]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 542, 920, 575]]<|/det|>
Describe **one** technique you use to obtain an accurate value for \(l_0\). You may draw a diagram.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 781, 920, 798]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 810, 146, 828]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 810, 549, 828]]<|/det|>
Suspend a load \(L = 1.00 \text{N}\) from the spring.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 828, 175, 845]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 826, 710, 845]]<|/det|>
Measure and record the new length \(l\) of the spring in Table 1.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 843, 175, 860]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 841, 762, 860]]<|/det|>
Calculate the extension \(e\) of the spring using the equation \(e = (l - l_0)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 858, 180, 876]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 858, 480, 876]]<|/det|>
Record the value of \(e\) in Table 1.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 875, 178, 892]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 873, 784, 892]]<|/det|>
Repeat the procedure using loads \(L = 2.00 \text{N}\), \(3.00 \text{N}\), \(4.00 \text{N}\) and \(5.00 \text{N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 890, 180, 907]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[195, 890, 589, 907]]<|/det|>
Record all the readings and results in Table 1.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[500, 42, 512, 58]]<|/det|> <|ref|>table_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[457, 72, 541, 88]]<|/det|> Table 1.1 <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[275, 98, 724, 273]]<|/det|>

1.00
2.00
3.00
4.00

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 633, 89]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the resistance of a wire.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 260, 120]]<|/det|>
Refer to Fig. 2.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[175, 125, 819, 352]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 365, 534, 384]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2.1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 396, 146, 415]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 396, 299, 415]]<|/det|>
Close the switch.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 427, 584, 446]]<|/det|>
Measure the current \(I\) in the circuit. Include the unit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[556, 458, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
<form>I = .................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 490, 146, 508]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 490, 653, 508]]<|/det|>
Place the sliding contact S at a distance \(d = 50.0 \text{cm}\) from B.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 521, 181, 540]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 521, 920, 555]]<|/det|>
Measure the potential difference (p.d.) \(V_{50}\) across length \(d\) of the resistance wire. Include the unit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 567, 336, 585]]<|/det|>
Open the switch.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[536, 598, 920, 618]]<|/det|>
<form>V_{50} = ........................................................ [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 630, 181, 648]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 630, 920, 680]]<|/det|>
Calculate the resistance \(R_{50}\) of \(50.0 \text{cm}\) of the resistance wire using the equation \(R_{50} = \frac{V_{50}}{I}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 688, 329, 705]]<|/det|>
Include the unit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[536, 749, 920, 768]]<|/det|>
<form>R_{50} = ........................................................ [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 781, 180, 798]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 781, 920, 826]]<|/det|>
Calculate \(r_1\), a value for the resistance per cm of the resistance wire, using the equation \(r_1 = \frac{R_{50}}{d}\), where \(d = 50.0 \text{cm}\). Include the unit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[549, 905, 920, 924]]<|/det|>
<form>r_1 = ........................................................ [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 92, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 685, 89]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the image produced by a lens.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 363, 120]]<|/det|>
Refer to Fig. 3.1 and Fig. 3.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[123, 128, 880, 280]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 282, 532, 300]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 3.1</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[333, 320, 662, 477]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 494, 534, 512]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 524, 146, 543]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 524, 920, 558]]<|/det|>
Measure the height \(h_{\mathrm{O}}\) of the illuminated object. Fig. 3.2 shows the height to measure on the illuminated object provided.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[549, 570, 920, 590]]<|/det|>
<form>h_{\mathrm{O}} = ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[918, 571, 925, 590]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 602, 146, 621]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 602, 730, 621]]<|/det|>
• Place the lens a distance \(u = 20.0 \text{cm}\) from the illuminated object.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 616, 845, 635]]<|/det|>
• Adjust the position of the screen until a focused image is formed on the screen.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 648, 737, 666]]<|/det|>
Measure the distance \(v\) between the centre of the lens and the screen.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[556, 678, 920, 696]]<|/det|>
<form>v = .................................................... cm

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[918, 678, 920, 696]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 707, 144, 726]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 704, 717, 727]]<|/det|>
Calculate the focal length \(f\) of the lens using the equation \(f = \frac{uv}{(u + v)}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[556, 785, 920, 804]]<|/det|>
<form>f = .................................................... cm

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[918, 785, 920, 804]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 72, 175, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 72, 702, 90]]<|/det|>
Place the lens at a distance \(d = 2f\) from the illuminated object.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 87, 173, 106]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 85, 724, 106]]<|/det|>
Place the screen at a distance \(s = 4f\) from the illuminated object.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 102, 170, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>•</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 100, 845, 120]]<|/det|>
Adjust the position of the screen until a focused image is formed on the screen.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 346, 151]]<|/det|>
Record the distance \(d\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 164, 917, 183]]<|/det|>
<form>d = ........................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 196, 630, 214]]<|/det|>
Measure the distance \(x\) between the lens and the screen.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 227, 920, 245]]<|/det|>
<form>x = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 243, 920, 262]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 273, 144, 291]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 273, 452, 291]]<|/det|>
Measure the height \(h_{\mathrm{I}}\) of the image.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[547, 303, 920, 322]]<|/det|>
<form>h_{\mathrm{I}} = .......................................................... [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 335, 144, 354]]<|/det|>
<label>(f)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 335, 920, 369]]<|/det|>
In this type of experiment, it can be difficult to judge the screen position that produces the clearest image.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 381, 680, 400]]<|/det|>
Suggest **one** precaution or technique to overcome this difficulty.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[833, 495, 922, 514]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[833, 507, 922, 526]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Total: 11]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 917, 104]]<|/det|>
A student investigates the bending of composite strips of wood when they are loaded at one end. The composite strips are made from identical layers of wood stuck together, as shown in Fig. 4.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment to investigate how much composite strips bend when they are loaded at one end. Fig. 4.2 shows the set-up the student uses.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 165, 819, 183]]<|/det|>
The student has a number of composite strips made with two or more layers of wood.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 197, 485, 213]]<|/det|>
You are **not** required to do this investigation.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[201, 222, 897, 293]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 313, 532, 330]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 555, 532, 572]]<|/det|>
